org.apache.uima.mediawiki.cr.parser
Class MWDumpReader

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.uima.mediawiki.cr.parser.MWDumpReader
Direct Known Subclasses:
MWDumpReaderFactory.MWDumpReaderLatestOnly
public class MWDumpReader
extends Object

This class is the core of the Collection reader component. It's dedicated to extract the relevant data from the XML stream. I tried to keep things as simple and robust as possible.

I make use of the StAX API to provide a pull-parsing style parser. The basic unit you can get from that parser is a page, also known as an article. You can also get the Siteinfo information (especially the namespaces) if it's present.

You can get an instance of this parser with the MWDumpReaderFactory. This factory also allows you to place various filters on the XML stream to exclude or include only certain pages or revisions.

Author:
Maxime Bury <Maxime.bury@gmail.com>
See Also:
MWSiteinfo, MWArticle, MWRevision

Constructor Detail

MWDumpReader

public MWDumpReader(XMLStreamReader reader)
             throws MWDumpReader.MWParseException
Initializes the parser. In particular, it skips a few unuseful blocks at the beginning and tries to compute the Siteinfo right away. It also initializes the data factories.

Parameters:
reader - An XML stream reader from which we get the data
Throws:
MWDumpReader.MWParseException - Exception is thrown if the underlying XML document is malformed.
Method Detail

getPage

public MWArticle getPage()
This method returns the last computed page. It should only be used after a successful call to the hasPage() method.

Returns:
the last computed page
See Also:
MWArticle

getSiteInfo

public MWSiteinfo getSiteInfo()
This method return the site info (containing namespaces in particular). It should only be used after a successful call to hasSiteInfo(). Otherwise, the fields of the returned object will have a default value.

Returns:
the site info
See Also:
MWSiteinfo

hasSiteInfo

public final boolean hasSiteInfo()
A successful call to this method ensures you that a call to getSiteInfo() will return relevant information.

Returns:
true if the parser has managed to compute the site info; false otherwise.

hasPage

public final boolean hasPage()
A successful call to this method ensures you that a call to getPage() will succeed as well. The parser tries to compute a page, taking in account the filters, until it succeeds to compute one or reaches the end of the document.

Returns:
true if the parser has managed to compute a page; false otherwise.

close

public final void close()
Use this method to free the ressources the parser was using (meaning the XML stream) in a clean way.

Throws:
XMLStreamException - If the XML stream fails to be closed.
